content:
Some opinion about filters as I understand them. Not all moments look logical

  1. All messages - not all, my messages only (Direct messages and subscribed streams), without public streams. Understandable name would be All my messages
  2. All public streams in organisation - understandable

  3. Direct messages - understandable
    but looking at the previous 2 points, I don't understand how I can see only all my subscribed streams (public and private) without direct messages. Looks like the filter All my streams is missing

  4. Starred messages and

  5. @-mentions looks unnecessary, since near we have the same thing in the menu and there it is achieved in 1 click instead 2 in filters

  6. Private messages filter by the same logic “in 1 click”, perhaps, would be more convenient in the menu, when clicked, the “more conversion” action would be performed in the private messages area.

To be honest, I recently saw all these filters and follow items, instead of filters, it would be more convenient in the left menu
All my messages
All my streams
All public streams in organisation
…

@Felix I don't really understand your point about "Mentions". Can you elaborate on that? When I want to see who mentions me, I find it very convenient to click on the item in the top left corner. I can also see if I have any unread mentions.
I think Felix is referring to accessing mentions and starred messages form the top search box?
Which is convenient if you want to combine it with keywords or other filters.
The point about 1-click vs 2-click in filters is down to Alya's point - combination of search/filter terms.
Re Stream messages (all my streams), this is effectively -is:dm?

Zulip's search has always been a frustrating topic for me, because it's one of the first things I worked on back in Cambridge. Zulip needs to embrace the concept of modals when it comes to advanced search, and it needs to embrace the concept of simple keyword search for other things.
The best way to search for stuff on Zulip is "Recent conversations", which is so well thought out IMHO.

To be fair, I can't find everything I need to find via "Recent conversations", but that's where I go for most advanced searches. The Zulip search bar is basically unusable to me for anything non-trivial, and if that is what Felix is critiquing here, then it definitely resonates with me.

Steve Howell said:

Felix I don't really understand your point about "Mentions". Can you elaborate on that? When I want to see who mentions me, I find it very convenient to click on the item in the top left corner. I can also see if I have any unread mentions.

I meant that the filter does the same as the menu. why is it needed then?
Screenshot-2023-05-19-at-09.16.16.png

The main idea is to make the transition easier with menus (in 1 click) instead of filters (in 2 clicks). Again, I saw these filters for the first time after many months of use :) I tried to show the idea in one picture. And I really miss the button to see only all my streams, without private messages
Screenshot-2023-05-19-at-09.21.16.png
@Felix Thanks for the clarifications! I think I agree with you, but I will defer to folks who use "search" more than I do.

@Felix My interpretation of those filters is that they're elements to help build up more complex search expressions, eg. is:starred is:dm banana. I believe that was Alya's point regarding 'if you want to combine it with keywords or other filters', which I attempted to clarify earlier too.

My take on the top left corner is to be shortcuts to those most frequently-used filters - excepting recent conversations and drafts, which are different types of view.

I've advocated in the past for a "streams" (ie. 'all my streams' in your words) shortcut/menu item/hotkey to parallel the private/direct message case. That already exists to a degree with the STREAMS title (eg. showing unreads), but previous discussion has erred away from cluttering the UI with eg. unreads for all stream messages there.

In general, there's only so much space that's practical to use here, vertically, since for now this section is a fixed height and doesn't scroll. However, there is design work afoot to change this :)

To build up more complex search expressions, I know it's possible to do that in Zulip, because I help implemented it. But I really think most humans are gonna struggle with the current UI. There is plenty of precedence for advanced search features that simply use a large dialog box instead of tab completion for advanced searches. You can just use the extra screen real estate to have checkboxes for things.

This is one of those areas where I put on my grumpy old man hat and say get off my lawn. In the 90s you had UIs that achieved this very simply with all kinds of technological impediments that don't exist today. Just pop a modal.

Steve Howell I thought you might be aware of how search worked ;)

I agree that the filter UI could be improved, and I recall a pill-based one was maybe under development or at least proposed at one point, but whether it's that or a modal, this is a different point to the challenge of arranging the top-left menu for 'common views' ie. shortcuts.
Still have a question - how to filter all my subscribed streams (public and private) messages only, without direct messages?
You can exclude direct messages (group and 1-on-1) with -is:dm in the search bar. And that should just be messages in streams you're subscribed to.

Lauryn Menard said:

You can exclude direct messages (group and 1-on-1) with -is:dm in the search bar. And that should just be messages in streams you're subscribed to.

Yes, its working, thanks. For older version is a -is:private

Is any solution to save such filter in the filters list?

Currently, there's no way to save/pin a particular search/filter, but it's definitely been discussed as a potential feature.

See #design > UI redesign: left sidebar links (here) for some of the resdesign discussion and plans for the left sidebar.

See #feedback > pinned searches for this specific feature idea.
